main event: A large, star-shaped object was observed moving up and down and side to side in Tuxedo, New York on February 15, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as having the color of a bright star.
Two pairs of small lights emerged from the main object, rose rapidly, and then vanished.
The main object was in view for several minutes before disappearing abruptly.
The sighting was reported by a well-known physician from Mamaroneck, New York.
The object was seen on multiple subsequent nights in the same general direction.
witnesses: a well-known physician and his wife
